review: I was looking forward to using this to watch my favorite movies and tv shows and set up was very simple, however, every time I try to watch something, it keeps buffering and when it isn't buffering the picture is blurry off and on (same with the Google Chromecast that I have - I thought the Fire TV Stick would be better based on the other awesome reviews).  My tv is semi-enclosed in an entertainment center but is close to the wifi signal/router.  Could the enclosure be interfering with the signal?  I would love to be able to get my money's worth and use this thing, but am starting to regret this purchase.
author: Amazon Customer

review: I had a Roku (box) & Chromecast prior to getting this, & so far the Roku is my favorite. The interface of Fire is just not as easy to navigate, & the remote app for your phone is TERRIBLE, you can't even see what you're doing - & it has to reconnect to your TV every time you open the app. Horrible. Also the Fire disconnects all the time, there is almost always a message on the TV when I turn it on & sometimes while I am watching, too. Half the time just hitting home & going back into the channel will work, but far too many times I've had to unplug everything to get it to reconnect.
